back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –2 (-4 instead if you have 2 or more clues).
[tablet]: –2. If there is a concealed mini-card at your location, reveal another chaos token.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, you must either spend 1 clue or place 1 doom on an enemy in the shadows.
name: Riddles and Rain
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –1 (-3 instead if you have 2 or more clues).
[tablet]: –1. If there is a concealed mini-card at your location, reveal another chaos token.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, you must either spend 1 clue or place 1 doom on an enemy in the shadows.

back_flavor: Eventually, you notice the tail. The figure stalks you through the rainy streets, pretending to have some other pressing task at hand. For once, you believe your paranoia may have paid off. But there is only one way to know for sure. So you test your theory - walking faster, moving aimlessly through the streets, and doubling back to see what they do. Every time, there they are. Watching you. It's a tail, all right. You flip the script and begin to give chase, instead. If they work for the man with the red gloves, you are going to find out.
back_text: Each investigator takes 1 horror. Put the set-aside Kensington Gardens, Westminster Abbey, and Big Ben locations into play. The lead investigator draws the set-aside The Red-Gloved Man enemy and resolves his concealed keyword. (Spawn The Red-Gloved Man in the shadows. Take his mini-card and 1 [per_investigator] decoys, shuffle them facedown, and put them into play divided as evenly as possible among the locations nearest to the lead investigator.) Each investigator loses each of their clues. Advance the act directly to act 2a (do not resolve act 1b).
flavor: Arriving in London, you patiently await your contact... but none arrives. Inspector Flint - or one of his proxies - was supposed to meet you at a quiet teahouse tucked away in a narrow storefront just outside Trafalgar Square. Wondering what could have gone wrong, and suspecting the worst, you set off to investigate.
name: When It Rains...
text: Forced - When this agenda advances: Move all doom on it to the next agenda.

back_flavor: Through the rainy streets and dense fog you give chase, but no matter what you do, the man you seek constantly eludes your grasp. All you catch is the barest hint of the color red as he slips out of view once more. Then, fast as a flash of lightning and gone just as swiftly, a formless shape ducks out of view. A chunk of a nearby telephone booth goes along with it. After a moment of trepidation, you inch forward and examine what remains of the booth. All that remains is an ectoplasmic substance, appearing like the negative of an undeveloped photo. It takes you a while to pick up the trail once more. When you do, you find that your quarry has fled to the east, where the Tower Bridge looms over the skyline.
back_text: Mark 1 time in your Campaign Log. Set The Red-Gloved Man enemy and each concealed mini-card aside, out of play. Put the set-aside Tower Bridge and Tower of London locations into play. Shuffle the encounter discard pile and the set-aside Crimson Conspiracy and Outsiders encounter sets into the encounter deck. Each investigator loses each of their clues. Advance the act directly to act 3a (do not resolve act 2b).
flavor: Your mind must be playing tricks on you. Misshapen figures dance through the dense London fog whenever the rain lets up. Are these distortions, like the one in the photograph Inspector Flint showed you? Or is it your quarry hiding in the mist and gloom?
name: Figures in the Fog
text: Forced - When this agenda advances: Move all doom on it to the next agenda.

back_flavor:
As the night grows deeper and the rain becomes a torrent, you flinch at every moving shadow, every sound, every shape. You wonder if perhaps this investigation is getting the best of you.
Or maybe there are more of them than you thought, watching you. Lying in wait for the perfect opportunity to strike.
back_text:
The lead investigator must decide (choose one):
- Search the encounter deck and discard pile for a Coterie Agent enemy and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck.
- Each investigator takes 1 damage and 1 horror.
flavor: It is clear now that Inspector Flint's hunches were correct. The man in the red gloves is not operating alone, and whatever he is up to, it has something to do with the recent vanishings. You could wait to report what you have seen, but by then the man and his cohorts may have already put into motion whatever scheme the planning. No - you have only one choice. You must find the man with the red gloves, at all costs.
name: The Connection

back_text:
If it is act 1, 2, or 3:
Despite your best efforts, the trail has gone cold. You cannot find any sign of the man with the red gloves or his cohorts. What's worse, you have no idea what their goal was in London to begin with. You have no choice but to report back to Inspector Flint with what little you have learned.
(→R4) (page 8) If it is act 4:
Your search for the man with the red gloves has led you into a hidden section of the tower prison. You duck under stone archways and sneak through dank, forgotten halls until finally, you find him: the man with the red gloves. He has lifted the lid from a stone crypt and is studying the corpse inside. The moment he sees you enter, he pulls a small ruby marble from the eyesocket of the unfortunate soul, then slips back into the shadows.
(→R3) (page 8)
flavor: Deep fog blots out the moonlight, bathing the city in utter darkness. From the rooftops, ravens watch your progress with inhuman intelligence. Every moving shadow sets your mind racing. If you don't find the man with the red gloves and stop his plans, who knows what he will do next?
name: Plots and Panic

back_flavor:
You spot the figure on the other side of the street just as a bright red bus approaches. You are certain whoever was there was staring directly at you. The bus cuts a swath through the foggy street, and when it has passed, the figure is gone.
Perhaps it is just your paranoia at work, but it cannot be a coincidence. It must have either been your contact, or one of their foes. Perhaps even the reason they are missing. Steeling yourself for any possibility, you set off in chase.
back_text: Put the set-aside Kensington Gardens, Westminster Abbey, and Big Ben locations into play. The lead investigator draws the set-aside The Red-Gloved Man enemy and resolves his concealed keyword. (Spawn The Red- Gloved Man in the shadows. Take his mini-card and 1 & decoys, shuffle them facedown, and put them into play divided as evenly as possible among the locations nearest to the lead investigator.) Advance the agenda directly to agenda 2a (do not resolve agenda 1b).
flavor: You draw your umbrella closer, using it to obscure your identity. Each person you pass on the street could be your contact... or be out to get you.
name: Clues and Capers
text: Objective – As a group, spend the requisite number of clues to advance before the agenda advances.

back_flavor: After much toil and pursuit, you finally catch up to the figure you've been chasing. A feeling of vindication washes over you as you spot the red gloves the man wears. It was no phantom you chased; this is the one you have sought all along. You corner him in a narrow alleyway, sheets of rain and fog masking your approach. Several more figures flank the man- a meeting, perhaps? To your surprise, he casts an expressionless glance in your direction. Then, fast as a flash of lightning and gone just as swiftly, a formless shape ducks out of view. A chunk of a nearby building goes along with it. When you turn to question your quarry about what happened, they have all fled east. You inch forward and examine the partially-excised wall, covered in an ectoplasmic substance, like the negative of an undeveloped photo.
back_text: Set The Red-Gloved Man aside, out of play. Put the set-aside Tower Bridge and Tower of London locations into play. Shuffle the set-aside Crimson Conspiracy and Outsiders encounter sets into the encounter deck, along with the encounter discard pile. Advance the agenda directly to agenda 3a (do not resolve agenda 2b).
flavor: You chase a shadow shrouded by night. It might as well be a needle in a haystack. But still you search, hoping for any clue that may lead you to the truth...
name: The Game is Afoot!
text: Objective – Chase down the mysterious figure before the agenda advances. If an investigator engages The Red-Gloved Man, advance.

back_flavor:
Quietly and cautiously, you follow the figure from a distance. With measured haste, he darts to and fro inside the ominous tower. Searching for something.
Finally, while you watch from the shadows, the man with the red gloves finds what he is looking for: a loose brick along one of the candlelit hall's many columns. He casually rotates the stone back into place with the kind of nonchalance as if he were dealing with a piece of misplaced laundry. To your surprise, a section of the nearby wall rotates in turn, revealing a secret passageway. He ascends into darkness, and you follow in secret.
back_text:
Put the set-aside Tower Prison location into play. Attach the set-aside The Eye of Ravens key to the Tower Prison, not controlled by anyone.
Move all concealed mini-cards in play to the Tower Prison.
Draw the set-aside The Red-Gloved Man enemy and resolve his concealed keyword, putting all of those concealed mini-cards into play at the Tower Prison.
flavor: Your gaze turns eastward, in the direction you last saw the man heading. Over the Tower Bridge lies the famed Tower of London, where even more eyes watch your approach, these belonging to a conspiracy of dark and brooding ravens. For what reason could he be heading there...?
name: Eyes in the Tower
text: Objective – Only investigators at the Tower of London may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

back_text:
If you defeated The Red-Gloved Man:
The figure reels backward, grasping at his wound. Something small clatters to the ground. The man says nothing - only glares at you fromthe darkness. His gloves seem to ripple around his hands, like the disturbed surface of a deep crimson pool, and after a moment, he straightens himself. Then, blending into the shadows, he tips his hat and is gone.
Add The Red-Gloved Man to the victory display. (→R1) (page 7) If there are 1 [per_investigator] resources on The Red-Gloved Man:
The man stops and faces you, seemingly intrigued by your line of questioning, although in the darkness you cannot study his expression. "... interesting," he whispers. "Very interesting." His voice has a strange, uneven quality, like he is testing the tone of each word. Like one unaccustomed to speaking.
Add The Red-Gloved Man to the victory display. (→R2) (page 7)
flavor: Somewhere in these forgotten crypts, the man with the red gloves is searching for something... but for what purpose?
name: Caught Red-Handed
text: The Red-Gloved Man gains: "[action] Parley. Test [willpower] or [intellect] (5) to interrogate The Red-Gloved Man. If you succeed, place 1 resource on him." Objective – - Stop The Red-Gloved Man from stealing The Eye of Ravens. If he is defeated, or if there are 1 [per_investigator] resources on him, advance.

back_flavor: Cold rain pelts the dreary streets in a rhythmic pitter-patter. Despite the hour, the square is bustling with automobiles, carriages, and pedestrians. Somewhere in this crowded city is the man you seek…. or are you already too late?
name: Rainy London Streets
text: Rainy London Streets gets +X shroud. X is the current act number. Forced - If there are no clues on Rainy London Streets: Add clues to it until it has 1 [per_investigator] clues on it. [action]: Resign. "We should wait for Inspector Flint..."

back_flavor: A fixture of the London skyline, the clock tower at the north end of the Palace of Westminster looms over the city, its face like the eye of a watchful guardian.
name: Big Ben
text: [fast]: Choose a concealed mini-card at Big Ben or a connecting location and test [agility] (2). If you succeed, look at the revealed side of that concealed mini-card (without exposing it). If you fail, take 1 horror. (Limit once per turn.)

back_flavor: The Gothic abbey near the palace is both a place of religious significance and a traditional burial site for English royals. Lights flicker in the windows as the gentle rain turns to an ominous downpour. You would not be the first to seek guidance on such hallowed ground, but you wonder what else may be at work within its aged walls.
flavor: Stories have been told of the prisoners who were brought to the Tower of London by barge along the River Thames. Perhaps you could follow their morbid example.
name: Westminster Abbey
text: [action]: Parley. Choose a location and test [willpower] (1) to ask around the abbey. For each point you succeed by, look at the revealed side of a concealed mini-card at the chosen location (without exposing it). (Group limit once per game.)

back_flavor: The night's unusually somber mood is enough to drown out even the beauty of the royal park. The Round Pond threatens to flood as the downpour continues. This place has been a popular meeting ground for many years- perhaps the man with the red gloves and his cohorts are here?
flavor: Stories have been told of the prisoners who were brought to the Tower of London by barge along the River Thames. Perhaps you could follow their morbid example.
name: Kensington Gardens
text: [reaction] After you expose a decoy at Kensington Gardens: Heal 1 horror. Forced - After you expose an enemy at Kensington Gardens: Take 1 horror.

back_flavor: Spanning the River Thames, the newly built Tower Bridge has quickly become a cultural icon, connecting Central London with the East End, which has seen much growth in recent years. To the north, just over the bridge, a dark cloud encircles the Tower of London.
flavor: Stories have been told of the prisoners who were brought to the Tower of London by barge along the River Thames. Perhaps you could follow their morbid example.
name: The Tower Bridge
text: [action]: "Maybe there is another way in..." Test [willpower] or [intellect] (5). If you succeed, put the set-aside Traitors' Gate location into play.

back_flavor: Although the original entrance to the water gate has long since been bricked up, you commandeer a small vessel and make your way along the river anyway. Perhaps there is still a secret route one might take from here to infiltrate the Tower of London.
flavor: Finding a way in through here will be tricky, but if your hunch is right, you might be able to slip in without anyone suspecting your approach. You prepare yourself for an underwater excursion, hoping the gate wasn't fully blocked off...
name: Traitors' Gate
text: [action]: Test [combat] or [agility] (5). If you succeed, reveal the Tower of London. If you fail, take 1 damage.

back_flavor: A conspiracy of ravens circle ominously over the castle walls. Far too many to be a coincidence.
back_text: The main gate into the Tower is locked and securely guarded. As an additional cost to enter the Tower of London, investigators at The Tower Bridge must spend 2 [per_investigator] clues, as a group.
flavor: Stories have been told of the prisoners who were brought to the Tower of London by barge along the River Thames. Perhaps you could follow their morbid example.
name: Tower of London
text: Forced - After you end your turn at the Tower of London: You must either lose 2 resources, or each enemy in the shadows attacks you.

back_flavor: What could the man with the red gloves possibly want in this place?
back_text: Forced - When a concealed mini-card would enter play anywhere other than Tower Prison: Put it into play at Tower Prison, instead.
flavor: Stories have been told of the prisoners who were brought to the Tower of London by barge along the River Thames. Perhaps you could follow their morbid example.
name: Tower Prison
text: [fast] While an investigator at Tower Prison is performing a skill test, spend 1 clue: That investigator gets +2 skill value for this test. Forced - When a concealed mini-card would enter play anywhere other than Tower Prison: Put it into play at Tower Prison, instead.

flavor: "The only detail I could remember was his gloves; red, red as blood."
name: The Red-Gloved Man
text: Concealed 1 [per_investigator]. Retaliate.

flavor: File #5-A19 / Subject Class: Yellow / Key appears as small red marble found lodged in eyesocket of deceased Coterie operative. Paradimensional capabilities unknown.
name: The Eye of Ravens
text: Shift - During a skill test at your location, the performing investigator sets their base skill value for this test to 6. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.

flavor: ...completely impregnable despite all piercing and crushing attempts. What could possibly be inside? A device? Or another world entirely?
name: The Twisted Antiprism
text: Shift - Draw the top card of the encounter deck. Then, if an investigator shifted this key, flip it to its [[Stable]] side.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –2 for every 1 [per_investigator] civilians slain.
[cultist]: -6. Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. That enemy readies and attacks you.
[tablet]: –2. Take 1 damage. A civilian at your location is slain.
[elder_thing]: -4. If you fail, discard 1 card from your hand at random.
name: Dead Heat
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –1 for every 1 [per_investigator] civilians slain.
[cultist]: -4. If you fail, choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. That enemy readies and attacks you.
[tablet]: –1. You may take 1 damage. If you do not, a civilian at your location is slain.
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, choose and discard 1 card from your hand.

back_flavor: As night falls, your sense of being followed only grows. Turning around, you see a trio of tall, lanky figures moving slowly. The shadows obscure their features, but a glint of light reflects on wet, red jaws and hollow eyes. When you quicken your pace, they quicken theirs. As the group bears down on you, you duck into a nearby alleyway and sprint away from them. After several minutes of running, you hear a rasping, gutteral howl followed by a sound like ripping cloth behind you.
back_text:
For every 1 [per_investigator] civilians slain, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Risen]] or [[Ghoul]] enemy and spawn it. Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
Each investigator decides (choose one):
- Heal 2 damage from each [[Elite]] enemy in play.
- I civilian at your location is slain.
flavor: Everywhere you go, you have the distinct feeling of being followed, as though the shadows themselves move of their own accord. In nearby alleyways and backroads, you hear the gnashing of teeth and the tearing of meat. The palpable sense of unease only grows stronger as night falls.
name: Gnashing Teeth
text: Each [[Risen]] enemy and each [[Ghoul]] enemy gains hunter and "Spawn - Random location."

back_flavor:
A crimson sunrise casts the ruined city in an awful glow: cars overturned, stalls rared, cobblestones covered in blood smears. What few civilians remain cower behind boarded up windows, fearfully praying for their lives. Whatever terrible thing Amaranth aimed to do here, she has succeeded. The city's ruin is a grim testament to her awful power.
Heart heavywith the weight of such great loss, you make a path through the devestation. A pack of the hungering dead catch wind of your scent and pursue you relentlessly to the city limits, picking at you with sharp, hungry claws. You barely escape with your life.
back_text: Each investigator suffers 1 physical trauma. Check which enemies are in play. - If Razin Farhi is in play, proceed to (→R1) (page 13). - Otherwise, proceed to (→R2) (page 13).
flavor: The city grows quieter as more and more civilians disappear each night. The soul-deadening heat of the day sees more hollow-eyed figures walk the streets. Once a thriving oasis of life and culture, Marrakesh now feels like an empty echo of its former self.
name: Empty Streets
text: Each [[Risen]] enemy and each [[Ghoul]] enemy gains hunter and "Spawn - Random location."

back_flavor:
Showing the photograph of Amaranth to several locals, they direct you to the verdant Bahia Palace Gardens. Approaching carefully, you find the woman with the red flower standing at the edge of a ritual circle, candles lit at each point, with gleaming offerings gathered around a corpse laid on an altar in the center. On either side of the corpse, two dead warriors are laid on the ground, bedecked in ancient finery.
"Soon, my love," Amaranth strokes the cheek of the corpse as the blossom in her hair unfurls. Tenebrous vines radiate out from the circle and creep across the garden. The grass and greenery shrivel under their touch, and eerie green light shimmers up the black vines, drinking the life around it. "It appears we have guests," Amaranth smirks.
back_text: Spawn the set-aside Amaranth enemy at Bahia Palace Gardens, (Lurking Corruption) side faceup, and attach the set-aside The Last Blossom key to her. Put the set-aside Save the Civilians story card into play next to the agenda deck. Shuffle the set-aside Khalid enemy into the encounter deck.
flavor: Strange happenings are afoot. A tomb robbery of an ancient philosopher. Rumors of the dead walking the streets. A string of disappearances. If you can gather information on Amaranth's whereabouts, you may be able to get to the bottom of things.
name: Find Amaranth
text: Objective - At the end ot the round, investigators at a [[Ritual Site]] location may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

back_text:
If this act advanced because of its forced ability:
"Razin, my love!" exclaims Amaranth. The body in the ritual circle rises to stand, along with two newly-resurrected warriors. Amaranth embraces the ancient philosopher, the two of them entwined with awful black tendrils. She speaks softly: "Let me make this place a paradise for you, my love. A true paradise."
Spawn the set-aside Razin Farhi enemy at Bahia Palace Gardens. Shuffle both copies of the set-aside Ancient Raider enemy into the encounter deck.
If this act advanced because Amaranth would be defeated:
Your final blow knocks Amaranth back, toppling an ancient brazier. As hungry flames consume the remnants of the ritual and the corpses, she screeches in anguish. "Do you have any idea what you have done? Razin, my love..."
Flip Amaranth to her (Corruption Revealed) side, keeping all tokens and attachments on her, and move her to a random location with no investigators. Shuffle both copies of the set-aside Ancient Raider enemy into the encounter deck.
flavor: A network of necrous vines has grown through the city, spurred on by Amaranth. The woman with the red flower is conducting strange rites upon a stolen corpse in the Bahia Palace Gardens. You must stop her at any cost.
name: Ritual of Life and Death
text: Forced - After a civilian is slain, if 4[per_investigator] or more civilians have been slain: Advance this act. Objective - If Amaranth would be defeated, advance.

back_flavor:
Amaranth's tortured cry resounds through the streets as she collapses. A heady wind picks up, whipping the dust in the street into a frantic dervish as the hot sun beats down overhead. Black ichor pools around Amaranth's body as the nexus of vines begins to wither and dessicate around you. The hordes of risen dead stop in their tracks, as if waiting for your move. You can see the remaining civilians of Marrakesh flee the city beyond them.
Standing over the beautiful, terrible woman, you feel a pang of pity. As you turn her over, you notice the voluptuous flower behind her ears has wilted in the heat. She lets out a primal scream as you pull the blossom from her ear: the stem is several inches longer than you expected, and sticky with blood.
back_text: Check your Campaign Log. - If the cell knows Amaranth's real name, proceed to (→R3) (page 13). - Otherwise, proceed to (→R4) (page 13).
flavor: Unnatural vines choke the city streets as Amaranth pursues you, drunk with power. The blossom in her hair stretches wide like a garnet maw as she laughs cruelly.
name: Queen of Nothing at All
text: Objective - If neither Amaranth nor Razin Farhi are in play, advance.

back_flavor: Your initial impression of Marrakesh seems pleasant, from the gentle, dry heat to the striking Moorish architecture and colorful tilework. However, you also sense an unspoken fear among those around you.
back_text: Forced - If Marrakesh Railway Station has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
name: Marrakesh Railway Station
text: [fast]: Move (to a connecting location). (Group limit once per turn.) [action]: Resign. You flee the city. (Note: If there are no investigators in play, all remaining civilians in play will be slain.) Forced - If Marrakesh Railway Station has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.

back_flavor: The center of commerce in Marrakesh, this huge open-air market is the go-to place for acquiring food and supplies. The air is thick with the music of buskers and the smell of spices and roasted meats.
back_text: Forced - If Jemaa el-Fnaa Square has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
name: Jemaa el-Fnaa Square
text: [action] If 1 or more civilians are on this location: Reveal the top 6 cards of your deck. You ay play an asset from among those cards (paying its cost). Shuffle the rest into your deck. (Limit once per game.) Forced - If Jemaa el-Fnaa Square has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.

back_flavor: The royal necropolis of the Saadian dynasty, this is the final resting place for much of Morocco's 16th-century royalty. Some of its beautiful tilework was destroyed with the recent theft.
back_text: Forced - If Saadian's Tombs has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
name: Saadian's Tombs
text: Saadian's Tombs gets +1 shroud for each civilian on it. Forced - When a non-[[Elite]] enemy enters or spawns at Saadian's Tombs, before it engages any investigators: Exhaust it. Forced - If Saadian's Tombs has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.

back_flavor: You have heard reports of strange disappearances near the tanneries, where leather is processed in large vats of pungent chemicals and dyes.
back_text: Forced - If Tanneries has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
name: Tanneries
text: [fast] Choose a [[Risen]] enemy from the encounter discard pile and spawn it engaged with you: Place clues on Tanneries (from the token pool) equal to that enemy's health. Forced - If Tanneries has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.

back_flavor: The sprawling and opulent palace draws many admirers. The jewel of the palace is its courtyard garden: an oasis of lush vegetation amidst a harsh desert.
back_text: Forced - If Bahia Palace Gardens has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.
name: Bahia Palace Gardens
text: [reaction] After you rescue a civilian on Bahia Palace Gardens: Heal 1 damage or 1 horror. Forced - If Bahia Palace Gardens has no civilians on it: Swap it with its set-aside [[Abandoned]] version.

back_flavor: The once-bustling station is now quiet and lonely. The attendants in charge have delayed the train until tomorrow; news of what is happening in Marrakesh seems to have spread quickly.
name: Marrakesh Railway Station
text: As an additional cost for you to move out of Marrakesh Railway Station, you must spend 1 resource. [action]: Resign. You run for your life. (Note: If there are no investigators in play, all remaining civilians in play will be slain.)

back_flavor: Wind whistles through the empty square, accompanied by the sound of slow footsteps and low groans of the risen.
flavor: Stalls and tables are tipped over and merchandize is ruined. The entire square is devoid of both patrons and merchants. You won't be buying anything here anytime soon.
name: Jemaa el-Fnaa Square
text: While you are at Jemaa el-Fnaa Square, increase the cost of each asset you play by 2.

back_flavor: This once-holy place is now desecrated and overrun with figures that reek of death and fresh blood.
flavor: Do the risen throngs still fear the tombs? Or do they merely resent death?
name: Saadian's Tombs
text: Forced - When a non-[[Elite]] enemy enters Saadian's Tombs, before it engages any investigators: Heal all damage from it.

back_flavor: For some reason, the risen dead have been especially active near the old tanneries. Why congregate here?
flavor: You watch the risen intentionally submerge themselves into pools of chemicals and swallow great mouthfuls of the foul liquid. Amaranth's power can only stave off decomposition so long. Perhaps this strange ritual preserves their rotting tissue.
name: Tanneries
text: Each [[Risen]] enemy at Tanneries gets +1 fight and +1 evade.

back_flavor: The once-vibrant gardens are choked with black, thorned vines. The remaining trees are frail and flake under your touch, and the fountains run dry.
flavor: "Man selects only for his own good: Nature only for that of the being which she tends." -- Charles Darwin, The Origin of Species
name: Bahia Palace Gardens
text: Forced - When you end your turn at Bahia Palace Gardens: Take 1 damage or 1 horror.

flavor: A piercing howl resounds through the dusty streets, accompanied by the sound of feeding. Bystanders flee packs of the hungry dead as you traverse the city. All around you is the scent of rot and blood. Only you can save the people of this city from a terrible fate.
name: Save the Civilians
text: The civilians of Marrakesh are under attack! By getting them out of harm's way, you may be able to avert a massacre. (Note: Civilians still on locations are neither rescued nor slain.) [action] Spend 1 clue: Rescue a civilian from your location (place it on this card). Forced - When the game ends: flip this card (keep all tokens on it).

flavor: As day breaks, the remaining survivors in Marrakesh emerge and the morbid arithmetic of counting survivors begins.
name: Aftermath
text: Compare the number of rescued civilians on Aftermath with the number of slain civilians on the Scenario Reference card. (Note: Civilians still on locations are neither rescued nor slain.) - If the number of rescued civilians is more than the number of slain civilians, each investigator earns 2 bonus experience. If the number of rescued civilians is more than twice the number of slain civilians, each investigator earns 2 additional bonus experience. - If the number of slain civilians is more than the number of rescued civilians, each investigator suffers 1 mental trauma. If the number of is more than twice the number of rescued civilians, each investigator suffers 1 additional mental trauma. - If it is a tie, nothing happens.

flavor: "Many say they would do anything for love. But I actually mean it."
name: Amaranth
text: Hunter. Forced - When damage or horror from Amaranth's attack is assigned to an asset: Defeat that asset and Amaranth shifts each of her attached keys.

flavor: "All of you are just weeds in my garden."
name: Amaranth
text: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - When Amaranth attacks: She shifts each of her attached keys. If damage and/or horror from this attack is assigned to an asset, defeat that asset.

flavor: "I have not crossed vast oceans of time only to be defeated by the likes of you!"
name: Razin Farhi
text: Alert. Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After any key is shifted: If Razin Farhi is exhausted, read him. Otherwise, he makes an immediate attack against the engaged investigator.

flavor: With dim light and thick clothing they can clumsily pass for living, but by daylight their unnatural pallor, glassy eyes, and gruesome wounds are impossible to hide.
name: Thrall
text:
The first copy of Thrall drawn each round gains surge.
[fast] During your turn: Attempt to evade Thrall. It gains alert for this evasion attempt. (Limit once per turn).

flavor: The former vanguard of Razin Farhi, these soldiers now serve Amaranth with an unnatural fervor.
name: Ancient Raider
text: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - After Ancient Raider attacks you: 1 civilian at your location is slain.

flavor: The former vanguard of Razin Farhi, these soldiers now serve Amaranth with an unnatural fervor.
name: Khalid
text: Hunter. Forced - Alter Khalid enters play: Move each other non-[[Elite]] enemy and civilian from its location to a connecting location (distributed as evenly as possible).

flavor: Those that ate the blighted crop died even faster than those who chose to starve.
name: Famine
text: Revelation - Put Famine into play next to the agenda deck. Increase the cost of each card you play by 1. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard Famine from play.

flavor: Although the risen move slowly, they hunt like wolves, surrounding their prey before they pounce.
name: Cornered!
text: Revelation - Test [combat] (3). If you fail, either (choose one): - 1 civilian at your location is slain. - Take 1 damage for each point you fail by.

flavor: File #11-B31 / Subject Class: Red / Key appears as flora of extraterrestrial origin, with long, black prehnsile vines that attach intravenously with host.
name: The Last Blossom
text: Shift - Heal 1 damage and 1 horror from each investigator at your location. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.

flavor: ...forming a neural link with host, much like the symbiotic relationship of a parasite, with access to host's thoughts and memories.
name: The Last Blossom
text: Shift - Heal 1 damage from each enemy in play. Then, if an investigator shifted this key, flip it to its [[Stable]] side.

back_text: Hard / Expert [skull]: –X. X is 1 more than the number of targets on this card. [cultist]: –7. If you fail by 2 or more, shuffle each concealed mini-card at your location and at each connecting location facedown, then place them at random in the positions they were in. [tablet]: –2. Cancel the effects and icons of each card committed to this skill test. [elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, you must either place 1 doom on the current agenda, or the nearest [[Coterie]] enemy attacks you (even if its in the shadows).
name: Sanguine Shadows
text: Easy / Standard [skull]: –X. X is the number of targets on this card. [cultist]: –5. If you fail by 2 or more, shuffle each concealed mini-card at your location and at each connecting location facedown, then place them at random in the positions they were in. [tablet]: –1. Cancel the effects and icons of each card committed to this skill test. [elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, you must either place 1 doom on the current agenda, or the nearest [[Coterie]] enemy attacks you (even if its in the shadows).

back_flavor: Hot on the thief's heels, you bust through the door leading to her current target, only to find her already leaving with a piece of the statuette. She gives you a mischievous smirk before escaping through a nearby window.
back_text: Reveal each concealed mini-card in play and set each decoy aside, out of play. Find the location with a target on it nearest to La Chica Roja (or her mini-card). La Chica Roja collects that target (place it on her). If there are 3 targerts on La Chica Roja, proceed to (→R3). Otherwise, resolve La Chica Roja's concealed keyword, distributing each of those concealed mini-cards as evenly as possible among each location with a target. Reset the act and agenda decks to agenda 1 and act 1. Add clues to each location until it has clues equal to its clue value.
flavor: La Chica Roja is stealing pieces divided up from an old art collection, which you believe are parts of an ancient Key.
name: Where is She...?
text: Forced - At the start of the game, or after the agenda deck resets: Set the amount of doom on this agenda to 1 [per_investigator]. Forced - After you expose a decoy: La Chica Roja attacks you. (Hint - when this agenda advances, La Chica Roja will collect one of the pieces she seeks!)

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the total number of clues on [[Cultist]] enemies in play, to a maximum of 4. (If it is act 3, X is 4.)
[cultist]: –7. You may place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy to change this token's modifier to a -3.
[tablet]: –4. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.
[elder_thing]: -2. Place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy.
name: Dealings in the Dark
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the highest number of clues on a [[Cultist]] enemy in play, to a maximum of 3. (If it is act 3, X is 3.)
[cultist]: –5. You may place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy to change this token's modifier to a -1.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail, place 1 of your clues on your location.
[elder_thing]: -2. If you fail, place 1 doom on the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy.

back_flavor: The daylight dims, and you strain your eyes to examine why. A strange, black shape has begun to crawl its way over the outline of the sun. An eclipse? Whatever the cult is up to, you better stop it soon...
back_text: In player order, each investigator must choose: Either place 1 clue (from the token pool) on Clues Unveiled, or search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Cultist]] enemy and draw it (if no [[Cultist]] enemy is found, place 1 clue on Clues Unveiled, instead). Shuffle the encounter deck if it is searched. For each eclipse that was on the agenda when it advanced, an investigator must resolve the above effect an additional time. Flip this agenda back over, adding 1 resource to it, as an eclipse. (It keeps each other eclipse it had, as well.)
flavor: The cult operating in Istanbul is secretive and deadly, with eyes everywhere and ears in every dark corner of the city.
name: Agents of the Dark
text: Each non-weakness [[Cultist]] enemy gains concealed 1. Forced - After you evade a [[Cultist]] enemy, return it to the shadows and resolve its concealed keyword: Take control of 1 of its clues.

back_text:
If the investigators reached the clue threshold first:
You discover what you believe to be the talisman's resting place and scramble to find the Key before your adversaries find you. But to your surprise, inside is only an ancient manuscript.
If the cult reached the clue threshold first:
You discover what you believe to be the talisman's resting place and find it already torn apart. Resting on the ground nearby is a torn-up manuscript, which you hastily begin to restore.
In either case: Resolve the concealed keyword on each non-weakness [[Cultist]] enemy not already in the shadows (as granted by agenda la). Shuffle the encounter discard pile and the set-aside Umbral Harbinger and Emissary from Yuggoth enemies into the encounter deck. Proceed to Act 2 Setup in the Campaign Guide.
flavor: According to Ms. Şahin, the talisman has been hidden somewhere in the city for many hundreds of years. You must not let it fall into the cult's hands!
name: Search for the Manuscript
text: Objective - Find the talisman before the cult does! If either the cult, or investigators at any location(s), possess the requisite number of clues as a group, advance. (Do not spend any clues when you advance.)

back_text:
If the investigators reached the clue threshold first, attach The Twisted Antiprism key to any investigator at the east gate.
If the cult reached the clue threshold first, attach The Twisted Antiprism key to the [[Cultist]] enemy with the most clues.
Reveal each concealed mini-card in play. For each enemy's mini-card, move that enemy from the shadows to that location. Remove each concealed mini-card from the game.
Put the locations from act 1 that were previously set aside back into play, with Hagia Sophia to the left of the entrance to the Grand Bazaar. These two locations are connected to one another for the rest of the scenario. Put Galata Docks into play.
If the cult reached the clue threshold first, for every 1 [per_investigator] more clues they had than the investigators, move the [[Cultist]] enemy with The Twisted Antiprism once toward Galata Docks.
Each investigator and [[Cultist]] enemy loses each of their clues. Flip The Unveiling story card over to its other side, removing all clues from it. Advance the act and agenda deck directly to "The Chase." It is both the current act and the current agenda.
flavor: According to the manuscript, the talisman was discovered somewhat recently by a third party, and brought to the Grand Bazaar as a valuable item to be sold. You can't let that happen!
name: Search for the Talisman
text: Objective - Find the talisman before the cult does! If either the cult, or investigators at the location designated as the east gate, possess the requisite number of clues as a group, advance. (Do not spend any clues when you advance.)

back_flavor: In the dark light of an alien moon, your enemies work tirelessly to escape with the talisman in their possession.
back_text: Each enemy in play moves and attacks as if it were the enemy phase (without exhausting). If there are fewer enemies in play than the number of investigators, in player order, discard cards from the top of the encounter deck until a [[Cultist]] enemy is discarded, and draw it (shuffling the encounter discard pile to form a new encounter deck if necessary). Repeat this until there are enemies in play equal to the number of investigators. Flip this card back over.
name: The Chase
text: Objective - "Get this thing out of here!" If an investigator with The Twisted Antiprism is at Galata Docks, you may proceed to (→R1) (page 25). Objective - "Don't let them get away with the Key!" If an enemy with The Twisted Antiprism is at Galata Docks, proceed to (→R6) (page 25).

name: The Unveiling
text: Forced - After 1 or more doom is placed on a [[Cultist]] enemy: Flip them to their clue side. If an enemy has more than 3 clues on it, move the clues in excess of 3 to Clues Unveiled, below. The number of clues possessed by the cult is equal to the total number of clues on [[Cultist]] enemies in play plus the number of clues on Clues Unveiled, below.

name: The Unsealing
text: Each non-weakness enemy gains: "Hunter. Prey - Investigator with The Twisted Antiprism." If The Twisted Antiprism is attached to that enemy, it instead gains "Patrol (Galata Docks)." Forced - When 1 or more doom would be placed on an enemy: It instead moves and attacks as if it were the enemy phase (without exhausting). Forced - After a non-weakness enemy attacks the investigator with The Twisted Antiprism: Attach The Twisted Antiprism to that enemy, [[Unstable]] side faceup. Then, that enemy shifts it. [reaction] After you evade or defeat the enemy with The Twisted Antiprism: Take control of The Twisted Antiprism, attaching it to your investigator.

back_flavor: The Galata Bridge spans over the Golden Horn, separating the piers from the rest of the city.
back_text: You can only enter Galata Docks from Galata. As an additional cost for you to do so, you must discard any combination of cards from your hand or assets from your play area with at least 3 matching skill icons.
flavor: With the Foundation's travel documents, you should be able to charter a ship out of the city with ease.
name: Galata Docks
text: You can only enter Galata Docks from Galata. As an additional cost for you to do so, you must discard any combination of cards from your hand or assets from your play area with at least 3 matching skill icons.

back_flavor: The ancient Galata Tower looms over this well-traveled district, where tourists and residents intermingle. You pass several embassies, warehouses, and commercial buildings for businesses both local and foreign. One of the district's older buildings may have once hid the talisman. Perhaps even the famed Galata Tower itself?
name: Galata
text: [fast] Spend 3 resources: Parley. Expose a concealed mini-card at any location. (Group limit once per round.)

back_flavor: Originally brought to the city from Egypt by the Romans, the Obelisk looms ominously over Sultanahmet Square. Its inscription commemorates the triumphs of conquerors past.
name: Obelisk of Theodosius
text: Forced - After you fail a skill test while investigating the Obelisk of Theodosius: Move 1 of your clues to the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy.

back_flavor: Housing faculties of theology, arts, mathematics, and science, as well as other recent additions, the newly reconstituted university is as prestigious as its campus is beautiful. If there's anywhere in the city you'll be able to find information regarding relics from its past, it's here.
name: Istanbul University
text: [action]: Test [willpower] or [intellect] (6). If you succeed, take control of 1 clue on Clues Unveiled. (Max one success per game.)

back_flavor: Originally built as a cathedral, the Hagia Sophia Grand Mosque is one of the most iconic buildings in the entire world and the epitome of Byzantine architecture. Having survived the city's numerous transformations throughout the ages, this holy place may contain a wealth of information pertinent to your investigation, if you know where to look.
name: Hagia Sophia
text: Hagia Sophia gets +3 shroud for each study token on it. [action]: Place 1 [per_investigator] clues on Hagia Sophia (from the token pool). Place 1 resource on Hagia Sophia (also from the token pool), as a study token.

back_flavor: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
name: Grand Bazaar
text: Increase the difficulty to fight or evade each concealed mini-card at this location by 2.

back_flavor: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
name: Grand Bazaar
text: While you are at this location, treat the text box of each [[Weapon]] asset you control as if it were blank (except for [[Traits]]).

back_flavor: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
name: Grand Bazaar
text: [fast]: Parley. Take control of 1 clue from a [[Cultist]] enemy at this location. Then, return that enemy to the shadows and resolve its concealed keyword. (Limit once per round.)

back_flavor: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
name: Grand Bazaar
text: Forced - After you expose a decoy at this location: Move 1 clue from this location to the nearest [[Cultist]] enemy.

back_flavor: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
name: Grand Bazaar
text: Forced - When you would move out of this location: Test [agility] (3). If you fail, you must either lose 1 action or cancel the effects of the move.

back_flavor: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
name: Grand Bazaar
text: [reaction] After you move to this location from a connecting location: Test [agility] (4). If you succeed, move again. Forced - After an enemy moves to this location via hunter or patrol: Resolve that keyword again.

back_flavor: The bustling streets of the bazaar's domed interior are dense with stalls and traders selling all manner of goods, from jewelry and clothes to carpets and furniture. Somewhere in this labvrinthine market lies the Key you and your enemies search tor... but where?
name: Grand Bazaar
text: [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, you may play a [[Charm]] or [[Relic]] asset from your hand, reducing its cost by 1 for each point you succeeded by (to a minimum of 0).

flavor: "Why do you suppose the keys have not been erased?"
name: Ece Şahin
text: [fast] Exhaust Ece Şahin: Look at the top card of any investigator's deck. If it is not a weakness, you may place it facedown beneath Ece Sahin (limit 5 cards beneath her). Forced - After any key is shifted: The owner of each card beneath Ece Şahin draws that card.]

flavor:
"Trouble with memory. I see things I never knew before. Other worlds and other galaxies….. Dark. The lightning seems dark and the darkness seems light.
-- H. P. Lovecraft, "The Haunter of the Dark"
name: Umbral Harbinger
text: Hunter. Forced - When Umbral Harbinger is dealt damage: Place 1 doom on the Cultist enemy nearest to it.

flavor:
I have seen the dark universe yawning
Where the black planets roll without aim.
-- H. P. Lovecraft, "The Haunter of the Dark"
name: Sinister Aspirant (A)
text: Alert. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Sinister Aspirant is ready: Place 1 doom on it.

flavor:
I have seen the dark universe yawning
Where the black planets roll without aim.
-- H. P. Lovecraft, "The Haunter of the Dark"
name: Sinister Aspirant (B)
text: Alert. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Sinister Aspirant is ready: Place 1 doom on it.

flavor:
I have seen the dark universe yawning
Where the black planets roll without aim.
-- H. P. Lovecraft, "The Haunter of the Dark"
name: Sinister Aspirant (C)
text: Alert. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Sinister Aspirant is ready: Place 1 doom on it.

name: Shadowed
text: Revelation - If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play, take 1 horror and Shadowed gains surge. Otherwise, find the [[Cultist]] enemy nearest to you. Place 1 doom on that enemy and test [willpower] (X), where X is that enemy's fight value. If you fail, take 2 horror.

name: Accosted
text: Revelation - If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play, take 1 damage and Accosted gains surge. Otherwise, find the [[Cultist]] enemy nearest to you. Place 1 doom on that enemy and test [agility] (X), where X is that enemy's evade value. If you fail, take 2 damage.

name: Light Out of Void
text: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Place 1 doom on the [[Cultist]] enemy in play with the highest evade. - Take 1 damage and 1 horror. If the investigators possess more clues than the cult, or if it is act 3, resolve this revelation ability a second time.

flavor: File #21-F30 / Subject Class: Red / Key is a trapezohedron-shaped crystal of unknown mineral, roughly 19 cm in length, impervious to both matter and light.
name: The Twisted Antiprism
text: Shift - Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Draw 1 of those cards and shuffle the rest back into your deck. Flip this key to its [[Unstable]] side.

flavor: ...do not store in darkness under any circumstances.
name: The Twisted Antiprism
text: Shift - The nearest investigator must place 1 doom on an asset they control, an encounter card at their location, or the current agenda. Then, if an investigator shifted this key, flip it to its [[Stable]] side.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the number of enemies in the shadows (max 5).
[cultist]: –6. If you fail, put a decoy into play at your location, flip it over, and shuffle each concealed mini-card at your location facedown.
[tablet]: –3. Set each non-weakness card committed to this test aside, out of play, as a hollow.
[elder_thing]: -1. If there is a concealed mini-card at your location, either take 2 damage or treat this token's modifier as -5.
name: Dancing Mad
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the number of enemies in the shadows (max 3).
[cultist]: –4. If you fail, put a decoy into play at your location, flip it over, and shuffle each concealed mini-card at your location facedown.
[tablet]: –3. If you fail, set each non-weakness card committed to this test aside, out of play, as a hollow.
[elder_thing]: -1. If there is a concealed mini-card at your location, either take 1 damage or treat this token's modifier as -3.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is 1 more than the number of [[Hazard]] treacheries in play.
[cultist]: –5. Choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow.
[tablet]: –3. If Void Chimera is at your location, you automatically fail, instead.
[elder_thing]: -4. Look at the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow.
name: On Thin Ice
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the number of [[Hazard]] treacheries in play.
[cultist]: –4. If you fail, choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow.
[tablet]: –2 (-5 instead if Void Chimera is at your location).
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, look at the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –2 (-4 instead if you are at a location with a Key Locus).
[cultist]: –5. If you fail, either take 1 damage and 1 horror, or place 1 doom on the nearest Key Locus or [[Locus Site]] location.
[tablet]: –2. If this is an attack against an enemy with patrol, after this attack, it attacks you, disengages, and resolves its patrol keyword.
[elder_thing]: -3. For each point you fail by, lose 1 resource.
name: Dogs of War
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –1 (-3 instead if you are at a location with a Key Locus).
[cultist]: –3. If you fail, either take 1 damage and 1 horror, or place 1 doom on the nearest Key Locus or [[Locus Site]] location.
[tablet]: –2. If this is an attack against an enemy with patrol, after this attack, it disengages and resolves its patrol keyword.
[elder_thing]: -2. For each point you fail by, lose 1 resource (max 3).

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the number of charges on The Shade Reaper.
[cultist]: –5. Place 1 charge on The Shade Reaper.
[tablet]: –3. If you are at a location with a [[Geist]] enemy, you automatically fail.
[elder_thing]: -6. You may place 1 charge on The Shade Reaper to treat this token's modifier as -3 instead.
name: Shades of Suffering
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is half the number of charges on The Shade Reaper, rounded up (X cannot be greater than 6).
[cultist]: –4. If you fail by 2 or more, place 1 charge on The Shade Reaper.
[tablet]: –1. If you are at a location with a [[Geist]] enemy, reveal an additional chaos token.
[elder_thing]: -4. You may place 1 charge on The Shade Reaper to treat this token's modifier as 0 instead.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is the number of locations in play.
[cultist]: –6. If you fail, the nearest [[Outsider]] enemy readies, moves once toward you, and attacks you if it is at your location.
[tablet]: –X. X is 1 plus the number of set-aside hollows you own.
[elder_thing]: -3. Choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, as a hollow.
name: Without a Trace
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is half the number of locations in play, rounded down.
[cultist]: –4. If you fail, the nearest [[Outsider]] enemy readies, moves once toward you, and attacks you if it is at your location.
[tablet]: –X. X is the number of set-aside hollows you own (max 5).
[elder_thing]: -3. If you fail, choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, as a hollow.

back_flavor: Before you lies an otherworldly landscape unlike anything you have ever seen - the twisting, jumbled structures, the alien flora and strange effigies, all of it against a backdrop of familiar architecture and gadgetry both modern and ancient. The ship that led you here teeters on the brink of this eldritch platform for a moment, and then, with a deafening ruckus, plunges into the endless oblivion below.
name: Court of the Outsiders
text: [action]: Resign. Test [willpower] or [agility] (4). If you succeed, you resign, adding each [[Conspirator]] asset you control to the victory display. If you fail, you remain trapped here, and this test gets -1 difficulty until the end of your turn.

back_text:
Hard / Expert
[skull]: –X. X is 1 more than the current act number.
[cultist]: –7. You may flip a [[Stable]] key you control to its [[Unstable]] side to treat this token's modifier as -4, instead.
[tablet]: –2. If there is a ready [[Outsider]] enemy at your location, you automatically fail, instead.
[elder_thing]: -4. Cancel the effects and icons of each card committed to this test and set each of them aside, out of play, as hollows.
name: Congress of the Keys
text:
Easy / Standard
[skull]: –X. X is the current act number.
[cultist]: –5. You may flip a [[Stable]] key you control to its [[Unstable]] side to treat this token's modifier as -2, instead.
[tablet]: –2. If this is an attack against a ready [[Outsider]] enemy, you automatically fail, instead.
[elder_thing]: -3. Cancel the effects and icons of each card committed to this test and set each of them aside, out of play, as hollows.

flavor: A flash of red and a fleeting shadow.
name: Coterie Agent (A)
text: Concealed 2. Forced - After Coterie Agent enters the shadows: Place 1 doom on it. [reaction] When Coterie Agent is exposed: Discard it.

flavor: A flash of red and a fleeting shadow.
name: Coterie Agent (B)
text: Concealed 2. Forced - After Coterie Agent enters the shadows: Place 1 doom on it. [reaction] When Coterie Agent is exposed: Discard it.

flavor: A flash of red and a fleeting shadow.
name: Coterie Agent (C)
text: Concealed 2. Forced - After Coterie Agent enters the shadows: Place 1 doom on it. [reaction] When Coterie Agent is exposed: Discard it.

flavor: The moment she described his outfit, the line went dead.
name: Conspiracy in Red
text: Revelation - Place 1 doom on an enemy in the shadows. If there are no enemies in the shadows, search the encounter deck and discard pile for an enemy with the concealed keyword and draw it. Shuffle the encounter deck.

flavor: "Flint, are you seeing what I am seeing?"
name: Pinch in Reality
text: Peril. Revelation - You must either (choose one): Spend 1 clue or choose and discard half of the non-weakness cards in your hand (rounded up).

flavor: They mostly come out when it rains. Mostly.
name: Heavy Rain
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, you must either take 1 horror, or place 1 of your clues on your location.

flavor: A flash of red and a fleeting shadow.
name: Coterie Envoy
text:
Aloof. Patrol (nearest location with a concealed mini-card and no Coterie Envoy)
While Coterie Envoy is ready, concealed mini-cards at its location cannot be exposed.
[reaction] After you defeat Coterie Envoy: Look at the revealed side of any concealed mini-card in play.

name: In Plain Sight
text: Revelation - Attach to an enemy in the shadows without a copy of In Plain Sight attached. If you cannot, In Plain Sight gains surge. Forced - After you expose attached enemy: That enemy attacks you and gets +2 fight until the end of the round. Discard In Plain Sight.

name: Knives in the Dark
text: Revelation - Put Knives in the Dark into play in your threat area if there is no copy of it in your threat area. Otherwise, this card gains surge. Forced - After you expose a decoy: Take 2 damage. (Limit once per round.) Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [agility] (3). If you succeed, discard Knives in the Dark.

name: Undercover
text: Revelation - If there are no enemies in the shadows, Undercover gains surge. Otherwise, test [intellect] or [agility] (4). If you fail, place a decoy at the location with the most concealed mini-cards, flip it facedown, and shuffle each concealed mini-card at that location.

name: Seeing Shadows
text: Revelation - Put Seeing Shadows into play in your threat area. Forced - After you fail a skill test while at a location with a concealed mini-card: Take 1 horror. [action][action]: Discard Seeing Shadows.

name: Figures in the Dark
text: Peril. Revelation - If there are no enemies in the shadows, Figures in the Dark gains surge. Otherwise, you must decide (choose one): - Each enemy in the shadows attacks you. - Each investigator loses an action.

flavor: "You know what to do."
name: Coterie Enforcer (A)
text: Concealed 1. Forced - After you expose an enemy in the shadows not named Coterie Enforcer, if Coterie Enforcer is in the shadows: It attacks you.

flavor: "You know what to do."
name: Coterie Enforcer (B)
text: Concealed 1. Forced - After you expose an enemy in the shadows not named Coterie Enforcer, if Coterie Enforcer is in the shadows: It attacks you.

flavor: By any means necessary.
name: Coterie Assassin (A)
text: Concealed 1. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Coterie Assassin is in the shadows: It attacks each investigator at each location with 1 or more concealed mini-cards.

flavor: By any means necessary.
name: Coterie Assassin (B)
text: Concealed 1. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if Coterie Assassin is in the shadows: It attacks each investigator at each location with 1 or more concealed mini-cards.

name: Swift Retreat
text: Revelation - If there are no [[Coterie]] enemies in play, Swift Retreat gains surge. Otherwise, find the nearest [[Coterie]] enemy and test [agility] (3). If you fail, that enemy attacks you. If you fail and that enemy is not in the shadows, resolve its concealed keyword (if able).

name: Bound in Red
text: Revelation - If there are no [[Coterie]] enemies in play, Bound in Red gains surge. Otherwise, attach it to the [[Coterie]] enemy with the highest printed health. Attached enemy gets +1 fight, +1 evade, +1 damage, and +1 horror. [action]: Flip a [[Stable]] key you control to its [[Unstable]] side. Then, discard Bound in Red. An investigator at any location may trigger this ability.

flavor:
My vision blurred as they manipulated the tool with some daemonic purpose...
- Virgil Gray, "In the Court of the Outsiders"
name: Key Charge
text: Surge. Revelation - Each [[Coterie]] enemy shifts each key attached to it.

flavor: File #AT-1S1 / Subject appears as hyperphysical distortion devoid of mass. Capable of "hollowing" contacted matter (see file #AV-245). Containment impossible.
name: Paracausal Entity
text: Hunter. Forced - When Paracausal Entity engages you: Look at the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow.

name: Apocalyptic Presage
text: Forced - When Apocalyptic Presage enters play: Each investigator chooses a non-weakness card they control in their hand or play area and sets it aside, out of play, as a hollow. [reaction] When Apocalyptic Presage is defeated: Instead of adding it to the victory display, discard it and choose up to 3 set-aside hollows. Add them to their owners' hands.

flavor: File #AV-245, supplemental / No energy conversion observed. What happens to hollowed matter?
name: Substance Dissimulation
text: Revelation - For each set-aside hollow you own, if there are 1 or more copies of that hollow in your play area and/ or hand, discard those copies and take 1 damage and 1 horror. If no cards are discarded by this effect, choose a non-weakness card you control in your hand or play area and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow.

flavor: File #AV-261, supplemental / Subject appears to have returned to normal state of matter.
name: Otherworldy Mimic
text: Aloof. Hunter. Forced - If Otherworldly Mimic is ready, when an investigator at its location plays, commits, or triggers an ability on a copy of a set-aside hollow: It attacks that investigator.

name: Memory Variant
text: Revelation - Put Memory Variant into play next to the agenda deck. Forced - After an event is played: Instead of discarding it, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. [action]: Test [willpower] (4). If you succeed, discard Memory Variant. Any investigator may trigger this ability.

name: Secrets Lost
text: Revelation - Test [willpower] (3). For each point you fail by, choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. If you succeed by 2 or more, you may take 1 horror to choose a set-aside hollow and add it to its owner's hand.

name: Paradigm Effacer
text: Aloof. Hunter. Forced - After you end your turn at Paradigm Effacer's location: Look at the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. Then, if you own 3 or more set-aside hollows, Paradigm Effacer attacks you.

name: Matter Inversion
text: Revelation - Attach to an Outsider enemy without a copy of Matter Inversion attached. If you cannot, Matter Inversion gains surge. Attached enemy loses aloof, gains retaliate, and gets +1 fight and +1 evade. Forced - After attached enemy is successfully evaded: Discard Matter Inversion and draw 1 of your set-aside hollows.

name: Emissary from Yuggoth
text: Concealed 2. Hunter. Massive. Forced - After you discover a clue at a location with 1 or more concealed mini-cards, if Emissary from Yuggoth is in the shadows: It attacks you.

name: Tenebrous Eclipse
text: Revelation - Put Tenebrous Eclipse into play next to the agenda deck. No more than 1 concealed mini-card can be exposed by each investigator each round. Forced - At the end of the round: Discard 1 copy of Tenebrous Eclipse from play. (Max once per round.)

name: Splintered Space
text: Revelation - Attach Splintered Space to your location and test [agility] (3). If you fail, take 1 damage for each [[Hex]] treachery attached to your location. After this test ends, if there are exactly 3 copies of Splintered Space in play, discard them.

name: Beyond the Pale
text: Revelation - Attach Beyond the Pale to your location and test [willpower] (3). If you fail, take 1 horror for each [[Hex]] treachery attached to your location. After this test ends, if there are exactly 3 copies of Beyond the Pale in play, discard them.

name: Warped Reality
text: Revelation - Attach to your location. Forced - After you end your turn at attached location: Choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. [action][action]: Discard Warped Reality.

flavor:
I felt a curious humming from deep within, as though I were being called elsewhere.
- Virgil Gray, "In the Court of the Outsiders"
name: Touch of the Beyond
text: Revelation - Place 1 doom on the asset you control with the highest printed resource cost. If no doom was placed by this effect, Touch of the Beyond gains surge.

name: Compulsion
text: Revelation - Put Compulsion into play in your threat area. Forced - When your turn begins: Reveal a random chaos token from the chaos bag. If it is a [skull], [cultist], [tablet], or [elder_thing] token, the first action you perform during this turn must be the below ability, if able. [action][action]: Discard Compulsion.

name: Distorted Reasoning
text: Revelation - Put Distorted Reasoning into play in your threat area. You cannot perform the same type of action twice in a row. (Types include activate, engage, evade, fight, investigate, move, play, resource, and draw.) Forced - At the end of your turn: Test [willpower] (3). If you succeed, discard Distorted Reasoning.

back_text: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the left position in the shadows, take 1 damage. - If it is in the middle position in the shadows, choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. - If it is on the right position in the shadows, take 1 horror.
name: Rambling Route
text: Increase the difficulty to fight or evade each concealed mini-card at Rambling Route by 2. [action] Spend X resources: Choose a concealed mini-card adjacent to a location X connections away. Look at its revealed side (without exposing it). (Group limit once per game.)

back_text: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the left position in the shadows, take 1 damage. - If it is in the middle position in the shadows, choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. - If it is on the right position in the shadows, take 1 horror.
name: Alien Frontier
text: Forced - When you move from Alien Frontier to a connecting location above or below it, test [agility] (5). If you fail, take 2 damage. [action] Take 1 horror: Look at the revealed side of either a location in the shadows, or the top card of the Otherworld deck. (Group limit once per game.)

back_text: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the left position in the shadows, take 1 damage. - If it is in the middle position in the shadows, choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. - If it is on the right position in the shadows, take 1 horror.
name: Weald of Effigies
text: Forced - After you reveal Weald of Effigies: Look at the top card of your deck. If it is not a weakness, set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. [fast] If there are no clues on Weald of Effigies: Either swap the positions of 2 concealed mini-cards adjacent to locations, or swap the positions of 2 locations in the shadows. (Group limit once per game.)

back_text: Concealed 1. Forced - When you expose this location: - If it is in the left position in the shadows, take 1 damage. - If it is in the middle position in the shadows, choose a non-weakness card in your hand and set it aside, out of play, as a hollow. - If it is on the right position in the shadows, take 1 horror.
name: Cliffs of Insanity
text: Forced - After you reveal Cliffs of Insanity: Move each concealed mini-card adjacent to it so they are arranged as evenly as possible in empty spots adjacent to locations not named Cliffs of Insanity.

name: Paradimensional Terror
text: Peril. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Flip each decoy over. Shuffle all concealed mini-cards in play, then place them facedown at random in the positions they were in. - Each investigator takes 1 damage and 1 horror.

flavor: "So vou--remember. The final-err."
name: The Red-Gloved Man
text: Retaliate. Forced - After you flip a key from its [[Unstable]] side to its [[Stable]] side: The Red-Gloved Man attacks you. Then, the Red-Gloved Man shifts each of his attached keys.

name: La Chica Roja
text: Aloof. Spawn - Location farthest from you. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase, if La Chica Roja is unengaged: Move 1 resource from each investigator to her. She shifts each of her attached keys. [reaction] After La Chica Roja is defeated: Distribute her resources among the investigators, as you wish.

flavor: "I have a hypothesis. Would you care to let me test it with you?"
name: The Sanguine Watcher
subname: He Sees What Is Not There
text: Hunter. Forced - When you defeat The Sanguine Watcher: He shifts each of his attached keys twice.

name: The Beast in a Cowl of Crimson
text: Hunter. Spawn - Location farthest from you. Forced - After you fail a skill test while at The Beast in a Cowl of Crimson's location, if it is ready: It shifts each of its attached keys.

flavor: "Dispose of these irrelevant rats!"
name: The Claret Knight
text: Spawn - Location farthest from you. Each other Coterie enemy gets +2 fight. Forced - After another [[Coterie]] enemy is discarded from play: The Claret Knight shifts each of his attached keys.

name: Thorne
text: Hunter. Forced - After Thorne enters play: They shift each of their attached keys. [fast] Choose a key attached to your investigator and remove it from the game: Add Thorne to the victory display. Thorne is now the bearer of the chosen key. (Update the Campaign Log.)

flavor: "I look out for my own."
name: Desiderio Delgado Álvarez
text: Patrol (nearest location with at least one other [[Coterie]] enemy). Forced - When another [[Coterie]] enemy at Desiderio Delgado Álvarez's location would take 1 or more damage: Deal that damage to him, instead. Then, he shifts each of his attached keys.

flavor: "You won't be coming back."
name: Amaranth
text: Hunter. Forced - When Amaranth attacks: She shifts each of her attached keys. If damage and/ or horror from this attack is assigned to an asset, defeat that asset.

flavor: "Shhh... soon, my shade, soon."
name: Tzu San Niang
text: Hunter. Retaliate. Forced - When you succeed at a skill test by 2 or more while fighting or attempting to evade Tzu San Niang: She shifts each of her attached keys.

name: Aliki Zoni Uperetria
text: Aloof. Forced - At the end of the enemy phase: Each investigator looks at the top card of their deck. Set each non-weakness card looked at in this way aside, out of play, as a hollow. If there is already a copy of that card set aside as a hollow, Aliki Zoni Uperetria shifts each of her attached keys.

flavor: If you know both yourself and your enemy, you can win a hundred battles without a single loss. - Sun Tzu
name: Inspector Flint
text: [reaction] When you expose a decoy, exhaust Inspector Flint: Cancel the exposing of that decoy, flip it facedown and either draw 1 card or choose a different concealed mini-card at that location to expose.

flavor: "The truth is out there."
name: Agent Ari Quinn
text:
While there is a concealed mini-card at your location, you get +1 [intellect], +1 [combat], and +1 [agility].
[reaction] After you expose a card in the shadows, exhaust Agent Ari Quinn: Draw 1 card.

name: Dr. Dewi Irawan
text:
You get +1 [willpower].
[fast] Exhaust Dr. Dewi Irawan: Either reveal a card from your hand to shuffle each copy of that card that is set-aside as a hollow into its owner's deck, or discard a card from your hand to shuffle any set-aside hollow into its owner's deck. In either case, gain 1 resource for each card shuffled in this way.

name: Expedited Ticket
text: Permanent. While embarking to a new destination on the map, you may exile Expedited Ticket and mark 1 time in your Campaign Log to travel anywhere on the map.

flavor: This dossier, while filled with important findings, isn't related to your situation in the slightest. You should probably drop it off at the sanctum Taylor indicated at your earliest convenience.
name: Foundation Intel
text: Foundation Intel cannot leave your hand.

name: Paradimensional Understanding
text: Revelation - You must either (choose one): - Immediately shift an [[Unstable]] key you control. - Flip each [[Stable]] key you control to its [[Unstable]] side.
